discussion.p: Table 80 lists the contents of the <cmath> header. It does not list abs(). However, 26.5, paragraph 6, which lists added signatures present in <cmath>, does say that several overloads of abs() should be defined in <cmath>.

resolution.p: Add abs to Table 80. Also, remove the parenthetical list of functions "(abs(), div(), rand(), srand())" from , paragraph 1.
resolution.note: Copenhagen: Modified proposed resolution so that it also gets rid of that vestigial list of functions in paragraph 1.

rationale.p: All this DR does is fix a typo; it's uncontroversial. A separate question is whether we're doing the right thing in putting some overloads in <cmath> that we aren't also putting in <cstdlib>. That's issue .
